Martensite is a hard, but brittle, phase that is formed when the alloy is cooled down below the Tm. Austenite is a soft, ductile phase that is formed when the alloy is heated above the Tm. The Tm is the temperature at which the alloy transitions from martensite to austenite. At this temperature, the alloy can be manually deformed and then returned to its original shape when heated.

4. Austenite is a soft, ductile phase that is formed when the alloy is heated above the Tm.
5. The transition temperature is the temperature at which the alloy transitions from martensite to austenite.
alpaca-7b_fact: Shape memory alloys are metals that are able to remember their original shape, even after being deformed.
